intro: Salsola papillosa, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing annual or perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant has small, pale green leaves covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and appear in clusters, contributing to its adaptability in dry climates. Salsola papillosa is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
